TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content: Are we going to use FAR in the future? Because I want to design a better plane and FAR can make a difference on how to build the best plane.

Oh, just a BTW, the plane I was making for a exhibition fight (strictly show) is almost done.

And it was a whack of work behind the scenes.

> 
> Are we going to use FAR in the future? Because I want to design a better plane and FAR can make a difference on how to build the best plane.

I won't be. Read the tournament rules of the next one.

- - - Updated - - -

I'm sorry about not doing any matches. Was waiting for the firestorm to cool down. But I assure you, the final matches are going to have some intense action.

- - - Updated - - -

Also, my next tournament will be using wing clipping rules that aren't too restrictive, but will stop insanity like the FA33.

So, it will be more free, but stopping unfairness. Also, I am going to wait till the release of 1.1. The panther engine is mandatory.

I envision a Top Gun AI Pro ruleset which embraces FAR and a few mods (especially procedural parts, and some engines and cockpits) to take plane design to the next level. It'll also make extensive use of radar - no more 360 degree pilot visibility, and might introduce air to ground as part of the setup conundrum - take out the radar and blind the enemy, or concentrate on air superiority regardless of radar?

I'll need a new machine to run it, which might take a few weeks.

In other news, the Little Buster has finally defeated the FA-33 in one round for the first time. It was a good and entertaining fight as well.

- - - Updated - - -

I can't help but notice that a lot of weapons don't have any point cost, such as the Howitzer, Chain Gun, and Rocket Pods. Does this imply you can attach an infinite amount of these weapons to your aircraft? 

Also, what does the ECM jammer do? Related, can you attach multiple radars to your aircraft, and if so, do they provide any benefit?
No, you aren't allowed them. The Ecm jammer breaks radar lock, and many radars can burn through jamming.
Would attaching several radars in multiple directions assist the plane in 'seeing' the enemy?
I guess so.

This is of the most successful variation of the final version. 

[http://imgur.com/YMTvrKy](http://imgur.com/YMTvrKy) 

If Alphasus would consider adding it to his tournament, I would much appreciate it as I'd love to see my planes in action against others so I can improve them. You're welcome to use these planes however you like, modify or take inspiration from them. I included all twenty developmental versions, so you can see the development cycle. The only difference between the M versions and the normal ones is that the landing gear has been moved back to prevent the plane from smashing its own engines off, which it has an unfortunate habit of doing, the Vernorless versions are self explanatory. The named ones, Heavy, Light M, Heavy - Vernorless etc. are the final editions, and the ones I'd like to be added to the competition. 

I'm aware the Heavy M is over the part limit of 125 by fifteen parts, if this is completely unacceptable then please use Heavy - Vernorless M, though I'd much rather have the former submitted than the latter. The second plane which would make an excellent addition to the tournament is the Light version, not M, not Vernorless, just Light. 

I am aware of the waiting list. Thanks for your consideration. 

EDIT: Please turn on the RCS, the plane doesn't fly correctly without it. It should be turned on at the same time as guard mode. I also can not determine how to adjust the guard mode settings in the editor, but they should be set to 1/360/3500 before flight, same as the FA-33.
